comments.body:
```ts
    [key: string]: any;
```
this could be obviously more specific, as there are closed list of props used in currencies and limited list of possible props values. Those would be optional though.

My reasoning behind not including the additional properties was that some of them (such as `regexp`, `regex`, `hashFunction`, and `iAddressTypes`) are used in only a couple of currencies, and there are some inconsistencies in the types. For example, I noticed that the `addressTypes` property of Tron contains `number[]` whereas the other currencies with this property have `string[]`.

I think that most of the properties are only meant to be used in the currency's private implementations of `isValidAddress`, though perhaps declaring their types would still be useful.
